heading: # Presets
headingText: Global presets are a way of easily preconfiguring a Vuetify application with settings and styles. Originally introduced in MD2, the [Material Studies](https://material.io/design/material-studies/about-our-material-studies.html) provide examples for modifying the default styling of Material Design.
defaultText1: The default Vuetify preset provides values for every option available for all services including language, styles and more.
materialText1: Material studies showcase the flexibility of Material Theming and components to create expressive and unique apps. There are 7 pre-configured presets based on the provided examples.

materialText4: You can provide a custom global preset one of two ways. By passing its value as options when instantiating a new Vuetify instance, or by using the **preset** property.
materialText5: Vuetify options are merged from the top down. The [default](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/master/packages/vuetify/src/presets/default/index.ts) preset is first merged with a provided **preset** property in the Vuetify constructor options. Finally, user provide options override the default and global options.
customText1: A Vuetify Preset is an npm package that can provide framework wide options and custom styling using Vue CLI. These features include:
customText2: configures framework options with a pre-defined values — can use any combination of the available [Vuetify options](#default-preset)

bootstraps custom SASS variables for configuring existing Vuetify components — presets use the [Vue CLI Plugin API](https://cli.vuejs.org/dev-guide/plugin-api.html#plugin-api) to hoist SASS variables during compilation
provides global overrides for styling that is not coverable through variables
